bibl.title: Despatch from Owen L. W. Smith to David J. Hill, September 16, 1899
Despatches from United States Consuls in Monrovia, 1852-1906

correspAction.roleName: U.S. Minister Resident and Consul General

p.add: INDEX BUREAU REC'D OCT 31 '99 DEPT OF STATE

div1.p: No. 35, Consular Series. Legation of the United States, Monrovia Liberia, Sept. 16, 1899.
Hon. David J. Hill, Assistant Secretary of State, Washington.

Sir: I have the honor to transmit to you the intelligence, that we have had a tremendous heavy rain fall, during the present, rainy season. The rivers, it is said, are higher, than they have been for any previous time, in the last ten years. While destitution is great, sickness, calamities and fatalities are not beyond the ordinary, for this season.
I have the honor to be your
